timeline.message: first lot of string literals extracted as constants
more string literals converted to constants
more string literals converted to constants

timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: It feels excessive turning number formatters into constants...
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: I'm not going to completely disagree with you there in that does look a little silly. It is worth noting though that in a number of instances a formatter is being used quite frequently (at least 3 for all the ones that were flagged but a lot more in some cases). For that reason, as silly as it looks, it probably wouldn't hurt to have a constant for them
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps make this "The requested ScoreType, %s, is not supported." and use a string formatter?
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Can do this but worth noting that sonar will likely flag this as needing a constant anyway
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: You could still use a constant for the string.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Although the string is the same, this use of CONTENT is different to above, i'd keep these separate to highlight that point.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Reverted. No point having the constant for just the name
replies.author: antares1470

replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: then just rename it to SELECTED_ATTRIBUTE_NAME :)

timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: I don't think the setFormat function actually works (a bug), but perhaps use the default Constellation format over this random format here, and move all the setFormat's to new lines to make it clear they are there.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Not sure what the default format is but I've moved setFormats down. I think this has been the format used for a while so I'm alright to leave the format as is (granted this does seem to be your code...)
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: This could actually be moved into AbstractTableTranslator.UnrecognisedColumnException.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Why a constant for visibility here, but not x, y, z, ...?
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Because the rule didn't pick it up. It has less than 5 characters (tick) and/or has fewer than 3 occurences in the file. Given the sheer number of these I had to deal with, I opted not to give myself more work than needed (i.e. go out of my way to find ones not picked up)
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: Up to you whether you want these as constants
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: This seems like a poor id value.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: Don't think you're wrong. Doesn't seem to make sense with respect to its context. Have renamed to LABEL_ID and the value can probably be addressed another time
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: ...especially since it's used all over the place.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: Is fatal supposed to be all caps?
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: You would think so, but it would appear that there aren't attribute descriptions for byte, double, or short
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: orly... well that sounds like it needs a ticket :)
